metadata.title: CVE-2022-3107 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel through 5.16-rc6.netvsc_get_ethtool_stats in drivers/net/hyperv/netvsc_drv.c lacks check ofthe return value of kvmalloc_array() and will cause the null pointerdereference.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3107` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-35-generic - 5.15.0-35.36
linux-image-5.15.0-35-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-35.36
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-35-generic - 5.15.0-35.36
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-35-generic-64k - 5.15.0-35.36
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1008-kvm - 5.15.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1009-aws - 5.15.0-1009.11
No subscription required

No subscription required
